files.summary: Add/edit form for call schedules in the preceptor scheduling module. Populates time slot dropdowns in 15-minute increments, loads activity names, cluster names, and day-of-week enable/disable settings. Supports both create and edit modes via querystring ID.
files.businessPurpose: Allows program administrators to define call schedule entries with start/end times, linked activities, enforced cohort settings, and day-of-week availability for clinical scheduling.
keyMethods: Page_Load - Initializes form with activities, time slots, cluster names; loads existing call details in edit mode
PopulateTimeSlots - Generates time dropdown items in 15-minute intervals between start and end times
DataTableToJSONWithJSONNet - Serializes DataTable to JSON using Newtonsoft.Json
files.migrationNote: Part of the preceptor scheduling workflow; scheduling is a core feature that will need modern equivalent

files.summary: Simple add/edit form for campus locations used in the preceptor module. Checks privilege access for ManageCampusLocations submodule, loads state dropdown, and stores campus location ID and department ID in hidden fields.
files.businessPurpose: Enables administrators to create or edit campus location records (name, address, state) used as scheduling and site management reference data.
keyMethods: Page_Load - Validates permissions, loads states dropdown, sets campus location ID from querystring
files.migrationNote: Reference data management page; campus locations are shared across scheduling features

files.summary: Add/edit form for clinic schedules, nearly identical to AddCalls.aspx.cs. Populates activities, time slots, cluster names, and day-of-week settings. Loads existing clinic details when editing via querystring ID.

files.summary: Complex registration form for preceptors allowing them to self-register or be registered by admins. Collects personal details (name, email, phone, address, state), specialties, affiliated sites, campus, academic year, session availability with day/time schedules. Generates dynamic HTML tables for session and availability selection via server-side StringBuilder.

BindSecondTable - Generates weekend (Saturday/Sunday) availability HTML

files.summary: Add/edit form for shift schedules, structurally identical to AddCalls and AddClinics. Populates activities, time slots, cluster names (filtering out Patient, PGY-0, Staff), and day-of-week settings. Loads shift details in edit mode.
